job_title: Cashier in El Paso, TX
pros: The pro with any job, your co-workers are mostly lovely. The work is easy, and you keep school hours with regular intervals off.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in El Paso, TX
pros: You get teaching experience.
cons:
If you are adjunct faculty the worst thing you can do is be at the part time teacher's common office. Although for the most part the people are lovely, they are full of regrets. It is demoralizing. They have been there forever and they hate their jobs, their students and whatever is going on. I don't blame the teachers themselves but the system that has them constantly scrounging for classes. 
For the administration if you're adjunct you're meat. They will limit your classes to no more than 3 courses per semester that adds up to roughly 1500 because of 'Obama-care'. You may end up teaching within EPCC but in various campuses. So driving from class to class is an issue. To make a living wage you will have to find classes in other colleges outside of that college. Each semester you might or not get the same number of classes or subject. To get a full-time job you basically have to wait for somebody to break a hip.

review_title: Flexible supportive environment, limited opportunities for advancement
job_title: Administrative Assistant in El Paso, TX
pros:
Everyone is pretty supportive with training and answering questions. It's a more or less laid back office environment, although there are constant deadlines to work under for project submission. 
 
The supervisors I've had, have been encouraging and understanding. No one is unbearable to work with, and the office in general encourages professional development and team-building activities.
cons:
I would say one of the things that bothers me most is the amount of gossip that occurs. And in all honestly, it's mostly the women who work in the office. I find it counterproductive and distracting. But, I know any office environment is afflicted by this issue. 

Another issue with the College is the lack of opportunity for advancement. People who become employed with the College, stay employed and are usually the ones applying for and filling higher-paying positions as they become available over the years.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in El Paso, TX
pros: they have short programs to continue your education specially for people who work.
cons: There is a lot of rasism going in that school;  who is packed of hispanics who hated other hispanics,  and try so bad to use that little power that they have as an instructor, to make them flunked in the tests and assignments. Even though that they make the assignments right. EPCC was a waste of time and money that i paid from my own pocket in  full and i did not received a refund from it. if you want to invest in your education do not trow your money to the trash with this institution that is not even seriouse go to a better college.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Mathematics in El Paso, TX
pros: EPCC is a fantastic community college to work at, great students, professional administration who is fully supportive and a sincerely supportive staff.
cons: I honestly have no cons that come to my mind at this time. I am sincerely content with my current job. I am merely looking at positions that are opening elsewhere, out of state, for financial considerations.

review_title: Varied, fulfilling work for those who enjoy teaching.
job_title: Math Tutor in El Paso, TX
pros: Students taking classes ranging from college algebra to calculus visit the center, allowing you to refine your knowledge on these subjects.
cons: The way it works is that students raise their hand and you (the tutor) go over to their table and assist them. However, you are only allowed 5-10 minutes to help a student per question that they ask. You can return later if they have another question but sometimes they need a little more time than that to really understand what they need help with.

review_title: Best opportunity that allowed me to work and go to school concurrently
job_title: Anonymous Employee in El Paso, TX
pros: Great scheduling, amazing colleagues and supervisors, great atmosphere all around. Can be assigned to work at any of the campuses all over the city.
cons: Only downside was that I had to resign from my position due to graduating. This is by any means a con but it does mean that when you graduate, you are to find something better in your field.

job_title: Faculty in El Paso, TX
pros: Flexible schedules and family oriented, upholds Academic Freedom, interpersonal relationships with other employees and Students, Academic Environment can be fun and exciting.
cons:
Unfair hiring practices, discrimination, nepotism, employee relations dept. for management not employees, favoritism, hiring not based off of experience and knowledge but rather off of who can bs the best during interviews. I've witnessed excellent candidates/instructors being passed up because someone didn't like them. 
Minimum pay for our level of education.  Truck drivers make more money without a formal  education.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in El Paso, TX
pros: One of the best places to work. Award winning institution. Best students with great potential. Lots of courses and degree plans and certificates available.
cons: Not much on the con side.  Some politics as found in all institutions. Sometimes schedules provide for long hours between classes, especially for part timers.

job_title: Student Worker in El Paso, TX
pros: The staff is very friendly and get along well with each other
cons: There are no benefits for part time employees, some employees are only allowed to work 19 hrs a week, there is no room to move up

review_title: Clandestine Employee Hierarchy and Illegal Deeds at EPCC
job_title: Teacher in El Paso, TX
pros: Free high schooling for most students. El Paso tax money funds such schooling. It has locations in all main areas of El Paso.
cons: EPCC administrators and managers always deny their employees' and their own wrongdoings. Their word, whether it's true or false, is what counts. So, EPCC administrators have a free pass to doing both good and wrong as convenient. Underground EPCC deeds include harassment, threats, bullying, thievery, and favoritism.
